China News | Today's Breaking Stories | Reuters https://www.reuters.com/world/china/ Reuters.com is your online source for the latest China news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub) RS集线器i@diygod.me (DIYgod) zh-cn https://www.reuters.com/pf/resources/images/reuters/logo-vertical-default-512x512.png?d=116China News | Today's Breaking Stories | Reuters https://www.reuters.com/world/china/ 2024 年 2 月 29 日星期四 15:50:34 GMT 120
Chinese outbound investment in EVs likely set new record in 2023Chinese outbound foreign direct investment along the electric vehicle value chain likely set a new record in 2023, a report from Rhodium Group showed, as western economies step up scrutiny of China's production-focussed, debt driven development model. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 14:05:59 GMT XJN2ZAD4FRLXXHAXFEJHEIJIPI https://www.reuters.com/business/chinese-outbound-investment-likely-to-set-new-record-2023-2024-02-29/Joe Cash商业
Fisheries deal at WTO insufficient for Pacific islands, Fiji saysA grouping of Pacific islands, including Fiji, Papua New Guinea and the Solomon Islands, are opposing a draft deal on changes to fisheries subsidies at the World Trade Organization talks in Abu Dhabi, arguing that it does not go far enough. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 12:58:58 GMT AFGVE24LB5MALLRKSAJBBUHXIY https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/fisheries-deal-wto-insufficient-pacific-islands-fiji-says-2024-02-29/Alexander Cornwell世界亚太地区
Chinese retailers further discount iPhone 15Major Chinese third-party retailers JD.com , TMall, and Pinduoduo are battling for customers by offering more steep discounts on Apple's iPhone 15 just five months after launch, as the U.S. tech company suffers slowing sales in China. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 12:31:16 GMT A4ZAFZMNKZNLNPWY7VKNX5文件https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-retailers-further-discount-iphone-15-2024-02-29/Yelin Mo, Brenda Goh世界中国
Germany wants Big Tech to pay towards compliance costs of new digital lawGermany wants Big Tech companies Alphabet , Amazon , Apple , ByteDance, Meta Platforms and Microsoft to contribute towards the compliance costs of new European Union rules aimed at curbing their power, a senior German economy ministry official said on Thursday. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 12:19:41 GMT 4YRUV66SNNN2LN6XRX537EPSSU https://www.reuters.com/technology/germany-wants-big-tech-pay-towards-compliance-costs-new-digital-law-2024-02-29/Foo Yun Chee可持续发展董事会、政策和法规
Morning Bid: Yen pops on Leap Day as PCE inflation loomsA look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan Thu, 29 Feb 2024 11:02:59 GMT AEAU6236IBKXZL5WOINCFCSCHQ https://www.reuters.com/markets/us/global-markets-view-usa-2024-02-29/Reuters市场美国市场
US to probe if Chinese cars pose national data security risksThe United States is opening an investigation into whether Chinese vehicle imports pose national security risks and could impose restrictions due to concerns about "connected" car technology, the White House said on Thursday. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 10:04:29 GMT KXEJVJ25QRMANJ4Z7K54H2U6KU https://www.reuters.com/business/autos-transportation/us-says-investigate-national-security-data-risks-chinese-vehicles-2024-02-29/David Shepardson可持续发展董事会、政策和法规
Finnish businessman Zilliacus pulls out of Inter Milan raceFinnish businessman Thomas Zilliacus said on Thursday he had dropped out of the running to buy Inter Milan to focus on clearing his name after police in Singapore issued a warrant for his arrest last week. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 09:52:27 GMT M2TS5EXXJJMCFLNZPDC3D3TJF4 https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/finnish-businessman-zilliacus-pulls-out-inter-milan-race-2024-02-29/Reuters运动的足球
Japanese investors allocate more to overseas equities than homeJapanese investors are hesitant to own their home stock markets despite the Nikkei's recent surge above bubble-era peaks because of uncertainty about sustained corporate returns and lingering memories of the 1990s market crash. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 09:47:13 GMT VNUV5656NRMSJPYUVGBB3LOK4Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/japanese-investors-allocate-more-overseas-equities-than-home-2024-02-29/Reuters市场亚洲市场
China slams foreign criticism of upcoming Hong Kong's Article 23 national security lawChina on Thursday criticised British Foreign Secretary David Cameron and other foreign politicians for "smearing" an upcoming Hong Kong security law, as local authorities said feedback on the law had been largely positive. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 08:05:25 GMT TYXRJHV75ZPZ5AWBL7AEPGLIVI https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-slams-foreign-criticism-upcoming-hong-kong-article-23-national-security-2024-02-29/Jessie Pang, James Pomfret世界中国
Chinese firms step up hiring, but tight-fisted on payChinese university graduate Zhang Baichuan travels hundreds of kilometres from one job fair to another in a final push to find a better offer than the unappealing one he received after more than 1,000 applications. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 07:56:47 GMT TMFSEHSYPBOKFEH7AUWZKFQLUU https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-firms-step-up-hiring-tight-fisted-pay-2024-02-29/Ellen Zhang, Xiaoyu Yin, Marius Zaharia世界中国
Sensodyne-maker Haleon jumps on share buyback, falling debtHaleon plans to buy back 500 million pounds ($633 million) of its shares this year amid firm demand for its products and progress in reducing debt, sending the British consumer healthcare giant's shares up as much as 9% on Thursday. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 07:09:08 GMT 27BX6U3ILRM37N25OLXQI4AXYM https://www.reuters.com/business/retail-consumer/consumer-health-giant-haleon-sees-higher-revenue-2024-2024-02-29/Eva Mathews商业零售与消费品
